# UnitDuration

**Class**

A unit of measure for a duration of time.

## Declaration

```swift
class UnitDuration
```

## Overview

You typically use instances of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitDuration] to represent specific quantities of planar angle using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] class.

### Duration

Duration is a quantity of time. The SI unit for time is the second (sec), which is defined in terms of the radioactivity of a cesium-133 atom. Duration is also commonly expressed in terms of minutes (min) and hours (hr).



The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitDuration] class defines its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension/baseUnit()] as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitDuration/seconds], and provides the following units, which [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitConverterLinear] converters initialize with the given coefficients:



## Accessing the Base Unit

- **baseUnit()**: Returns the base unit.

## Accessing Predefined Units

- **hours**: The hour unit of duration.
- **minutes**: The minute unit of duration.
- **seconds**: The second unit of duration.
- **milliseconds**: The millisecond unit of duration.
- **microseconds**: The microsecond unit of duration.
- **nanoseconds**: The nanosecond unit of duration.
- **picoseconds**: The picosecond unit of duration.

## Time and Motion

- **UnitAcceleration**: A unit of measure for acceleration.
- **UnitFrequency**: A unit of measure for frequency.
- **UnitSpeed**: A unit of measure for speed.

- Dimension
